page.title: 04Housing in Eccleshall
page.content: A few long established large, private residences on the periphery of the town, e.g. Eccleshall Castle, dominate this rural area which comprises old traditional agricultural housing with many old cottages recently developed into larger properties mainly for commuters.{Town housing}consisting of a relatively small village-sized core of older properties and two modern 3 storey blocks of purpose-built flats, is surrounded on two sides by several developments of small to medium family houses. Major modern town enlargement which has evolved over the last twenty years has come to a virtual standstill owing to local pressure from the {District Plan}produced in the 1970s.
